alert.note: Alert for Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:43PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin County through 215 PM EST... At 143 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from Nettles Island to 6 miles southwest of Indiantown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stuart, Indiantown, Tequesta, Jupiter Island and Palm City. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
